Judul: CULTURAL STUDIES AND LATIN AMERICANISM: INTELLECTUALS, CULTURE AND IDEOLOGY
Abstrak: An interview with cultural studies scholar Santiago Castro-Gómez is presented. He opines that Cultural Studies did not exist in Latin America before the 1980s. Castro-Gómez explains that he considers "Latin America" to be a signifier that needs to be investigated, rather than a definite place. He also discusses the relationship that he perceives between "social imaginaries" and global capitalism.
Sumber: Cultural Studies Vol. 26, No. 1 January 2012, pp. 62-70
